description: The Nifty 50 is a well diversified 50 stock index and it represent important sectors of the economy.

Nifty Bank Index is comprised of the most liquid and large capitalised Indian Banking stocks. It provides investors and market intermediaries with a benchmark that captures the capital market performance of Indian Banks.
Allows investors to gain exposure to the performance of the auto industry through a single investment.
The Nifty Pharma Index is designed to reflect the behavior and performance of the pharmaceutical sector in India.
Nifty Midcap 150 represents 150 companies (companies ranked 101-250) based on full market capitalisation from Nifty 500.

underlying: Mirae Asset Nifty Smallcap 250 Momentum Quality 100 ETF
description: Nifty Smallcap 250 represents 250 companies (companies ranked 251-500) from Nifty 500. This index intends to measure the performance of small market capitalisation companies

underlying: Nifty India Defence Total Return Index
description: The Nifty India Defence Index which aims to track the performance of portfolio of stocks that broadly represent the Defence theme. From the Nifty Total Market index, stocks forming part of eligible basic industries or those which obtain at least 10% of revenues from the defence industry are eligible to be included in the index and are chosen based on 6 month average free-float market capitalization. The weight of the stocks in the index is based on their free-float market capitalization. Stock weights are capped at 20%.
NYSE Tech Companies (Facebook, Apple, Netflix, Google +

The Nifty India Digital Index aims to track the performance of portfolio of stocks that broadly represent the Digital theme. The largest 30 stocks from eligible basic industries are chosen based on 6 month average free-float market capitalization. The weight of the stocks in the index is based on their free-float market capitalization.

underlying: Nifty India Manufacturing Total Return Index
description: The Nifty India Manufacturing Index which aims to track the performance of the companies selected from the combined universe of Nifty 100, Nifty Midcap 150 and Nifty Smallcap 50 index based on 6 month average free-float market capitalisation within the eligible basic industries that broadly represent manufacturing sector.
The Nifty Shariah Indices are designed to offer investors Shariah-compliant investment solutions.
The fund aims to provide returns that closely correspond to the return provided by the price of gold through investment in physical gold.
The scheme seeks to generate returns that are in line with the performance of physical silver in domestic prices
